result.execSummary:
The defendant David Serna-Vicente was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) - 3rd Offense, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $250.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) - 3rd Offense

defendant.name: Serna-Vicente, David

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:34 PM: Defendant David Serna-Vicente in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present at Interpreter.   Interpreter oath given by the Court. Per ADA:  Terms of offer recited - NC to Ct 1 with entirely argued sentencing.  State intends to argue for a guideline penalty.  Def and counsel confirm State's recital.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea (OAR 3):  GP   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Argument by ADA.  Argument by Atty Zamzow - argues against any imposed County Jail - solely fine and costs.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Needs to balance this situation - Advises Def he cannot drive and the Court must apply the law.  Recognizes 4 yrs since last violation.  Imposes 5 days WCJ, GT and Huber,  No TS credit, Report: 7/15/15 at 8:00 PM.  Court Costs - 60 DTP after bond application.  Hispanic Appeal Rights Given.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 2:57 PM: Defendant David Serna-Vicente in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpeter.  Oath administered at previous hearing today.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def states he wants counsel, but would like to know any possible sentence prior to deciding on counsel issue.  Def requests to speak with the State prior to deciding on counsel issue.  Off Record for Def to speak with the DA.   Back of Record at 3:04 PM:  States Def may now wish to obtain counsel.  Def employed full time.  Court does not believe that Def will qualify for SPD services based upon earnings.  Def states he will retain his own counsel and the Court will proceed with that understanding.  Cash Bond ordered with conditions.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and finds probable cause supporting charge alleged in Count No. 1.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
